org.kepler.gui

Class SearchUIJPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • org.kepler.gui.SearchUIJPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class SearchUIJPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    Class to build the Search User Interface JPanel that allows the user to enter a single search term to search by. 5 buttons can be optionally configured by setting Actions for those buttons.
      The 5 configurable buttons are
    • Search Button
    • Reset Button
    • Cancel Button
    • Source Button
    • Advanced Button
    Since:
    4 Nov 2005
    Author:
    brooke
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • SearchUIJPanel

        public SearchUIJPanel()
        Empty constructor.

      • SearchUIJPanel

        public SearchUIJPanel(java.lang.String panelBorderTitle,
                      javax.swing.Action searchButtonAction,
                      javax.swing.Action resetButtonAction,
                      javax.swing.Action cancelButtonAction,
                      javax.swing.Action sourceButtonAction,
                      javax.swing.Action advancedButtonAction)
        Constructor - creates a panel with a titled border (from String param panelBorderTitle), containing a textfield with up to 5 buttons beneath it. Constructor can accept javax.swing.Action objects for these 5 buttons; if any of these Action objects is null, the button will not be displayed on the user interface at runtime
        Parameters:
        panelBorderTitle - String
        searchButtonAction - Action
        resetButtonAction - Action
        cancelButtonAction - Action
        sourceButtonAction - Action
        advancedButtonAction - Action

    • Method Detail

      • getBorderTitle

        public java.lang.String getBorderTitle()
        Returns the border title for this search panel. The default title is "Search".
        Returns:
        the search border title

      • setBorderTitle

        public void setBorderTitle(java.lang.String borderTitle)

      • getSearchAction

        public javax.swing.Action getSearchAction()
        Returns the javax.swing.Action object that is called when the Search button is pressed.
        Returns:
        the Action object that handles the search button

      • setSearchAction

        public void setSearchAction(javax.swing.Action searchAction)
        Sets the Action to be used when the Search button is pressed. If this Action is not set then the Search button will not be visible to the user.
        Parameters:
        searchAction - the Action to be used when the Search button is pressed

      • getCancelAction

        Returns the javax.swing.Action object that is called when the Cancel button is pressed.

      • getMinimumWidth

        public final int getMinimumWidth()
        get the preferred/minimum width of this panel - calculated to allow enough space for all buttons and spacers etc
        Returns:
        the minimum allowable width of this panel

      • setSearchTerm

        public void setSearchTerm(java.lang.String searchTerm)
        set the current search term String in the textfield
        Parameters:
        searchTerm - String

      • setSearchEnabled

        public void setSearchEnabled(boolean enabled)
        if enabled==true, enable the textfield, search, reset, source and advanced buttons, and disable the cancel button. If enabled==false, do the reverse.
        Parameters:
        enabled - boolean

      • setCancelButtonEnabled

        public void setCancelButtonEnabled(boolean enabled)

      • setAllSearchEnabled

        public void setAllSearchEnabled(boolean enabled)
        Enables/disables _all_ Search buttons we will use this to disable all buttons as we fetch datasources from the repository if enabled==true, enable the textfield, search, reset, source and advanced buttons, and cancel button. If enabled==false, do the reverse.
        Parameters:
        enabled - boolean

      • init

        public void init()
        Initialize the search panel. This should be called after constructing and adding whichever Actions you want the search panel to contain.

      • closing

        public void closing()
